definitions.definition: Reliability or uniformity ; the quality of being consistent .
examples: They want to achieve a high degree of consistency in their process and their product.

definitions.definition: The degree of viscosity of something.
examples: Mix it until it has the consistency of a thick paste.

definitions.definition: Freedom from contradiction ; the state of a system of axioms such that none of the propositions deduced from them are mutually contradictory .
Firmness of constitution or character; substantiality; durability; persistency.

secondary_definitions: Reliability or uniformity ; the quality of being consistent .
The degree of viscosity of something.
( logic ) Freedom from contradiction ; the state of a system of axioms such that none of the propositions deduced from them are mutually contradictory .
( obsolete ) Firmness of constitution or character; substantiality; durability; persistency.
